onboarding1_text1: Discover your past and explore your future.

america_text:
Explorer Christopher Columbus (1451–1506) is known for his 1492 ‘discovery’ of the 'new world' of the Americas on board his ship Santa Maria.
In actual fact, Columbus did not discover North America. He was the first European to sight the Bahamas archipelago and then the island later named Hispaniola, now split into Haiti and the Dominican Republic. On his subsequent ...
greek_text: Ancient Greece (800 BCE – 146 BCE) shaped Western civilization with its contributions to philosophy, democracy, and the arts. Athens pioneered early democratic governance, though it excluded women and slaves. Thinkers like Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle influenced modern thought, while the Olympic Games showcased athletic excellence. Greek culture spread through trade and conquest, leaving a lasting legacy...
pyramids_text: The ancient Egyptians built the pyramids, especially the Great Pyramid of Giza (2580–2560 BCE), using a skilled workforce of well-fed laborers, not slaves. They employed advanced techniques to transport massive limestone blocks, demonstrating remarkable engineering. The pyramids served as tombs for pharaohs, reflecting beliefs in the afterlife and immortality...
in_greek_mythology_the_trojan_horse_was_: In Greek mythology, the Trojan Horse was a wooden horse used for war
